medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 3 months before admission, with intermittent dizziness, palpitations, near syncope, diaphoresis, polyuria, polydipsia, diarrhea, chest and abdominal pain, headaches, and increasing protuberance of the eyes. Three weeks before admission, the patient reported awakening with low energy and interest, auditory hallucinations, and self-harm behaviors. Symptoms worsened with increased distress regarding her physical appearance.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Graves' disease, anemia as an infant, and cholecystectomy at age 14. No current medications; immunizations are up to date.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with celiac disease; paternal aunt with hypothyroidism; paternal grandmother with vitiligo and thyroidectomy. Father and siblings are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Born in the Dominican Republic, lived with her parents, maternal grandmother, and two sisters. Enrolled in an individualized education program in high school. No smoking, alcohol consumption, or illicit drug use.
